question: At which of the following places, Jain and Brahmanical (Saiva and Vaishnava) temples were erected in the typical Aryavarta style in medieval India?
explanation: The period from 600 A.D. to 1000 A.D. was the golden era of religious architecture. The Hindu monarchs competed with one another in the magnificence and number of their temples. At Khajuraho, Jain and Brahmanical (Saiva and Vaishnava) temples were erected in the typical Aryavarta style.
